intro: Gastrolychnis triflora subsp. dawsonii, commonly known as Dawson's mallow, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, pale yellow to white flowers. It typically grows in moist, shady environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for both ecological and horticultural study.
